The process of farming and retrieving pearls takes years. 8:30: Do kayaking to explore Halong Bay 10:00: Check-out and enjoy a fantastic cruise on the bay. 10:45: Enjoy the lunch while Cruising back to Tuan Chau Harbour. 12:00: Cruise is landing Halong Bay harbor, tourist say goodbye to sailors and finish the cruise. 12:30: Return to Hanoi by shuttle bus. 14:30: Stopover in Hai Duong province for short break. 16:30: Arrive in Hanoi and we will prepare a small hotel where you can take a shower and take a rét before getting sleeping bus to Sapa 21:30: Tour guide and bus pick you up at hotel and transfer to Sapa Town.

timeline.title: Day 5: SaPa arrival – Trekking to Y Linh Ho – Lao Chai – Ta Van (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)
timeline.description: 5:30AM: Arrive in Lao Cai around, we will take 1 hour van ride uphill to the beautiful town of Sapa. The ride gives you a glimpse of the stunning vistas and impressive rice terraces. Upon arrival Sapa town. 7:00AM: We have breakfast at the hotel. And relax about 2 hour, you can take a shower. 9.00 - 9.30: Begin a short walk of 5km along mountain trail to visit Y Linh Ho village which is inhabited by black Hmong tribe and completely secluded from tourists, especially you are able to embrace raw Sapa culture and community by coming into some native houses to discover their own culture and custom as well as study how the local tribe make handicraft from natural materials such as: hemp, indigo…ect. Continuing to walk down MuongHoaRiver where you can take a rest or swim before trekking uphill to Lao Chai village where your picnic lunch will be served.  13.00: After lunch, you will visit the Day and Red Dzao tribes of Tavan village, which lies in the middle of MuongHoa valley where excellent panoramas of rice terraced fields.  15h00 – 15h30: There you will have dinner and stay over night at local house. Accommodation: Homestay in Sapa with local people

timeline.title: Day 6: Ta Van – Giang Ta Chai – Su Pan – Sapa – Sleeping Bus to Hanoi ( Breakfast, Lunch)
timeline.description: 8.00:You have breakfast at the home stay before trekking about 8km towards the Red Dzaovillage of Giang Ta Chai. On the way you will trek up and downhill then through bamboo forest before arriving at the waterfall, Rattan bridge and Stream where you have short rest to swim and picnic lunch.  14h30 Continuing to walk uphill about 2km to HauThao village where we catch the car to return to Sapa. You are free to discover Sapa town and Market before having dinner then being transferred to bus station to catch the night bus to Hanoi.

timeline.title: Day 7: Hanoi departure
timeline.description:
4:00AM: Hanoi arrival, take a rest at bus staion in Hanoi. Enjoy your free time in Hanoi before departure time.  It's time to say goodbye and thanks for using our service!End point
 Your hotel/stay in Hanoi Old Quarter, Hanoi, Vietnam 04:00 - 04:30

name: Low Budget Vietnam Tour from Hanoi, Halong Bay to Da Nang, Hoi An, Saigon
summary: This 8-day Vietnam Tour inspire you to take in the delight of exploring the best highlights of Vietnam. You will be immersed in the special beauty of Hanoi, cruise around the picturesque backdrop of Halong seascape, walk in the quiet streets of Hoi An Ancient Town, and enjoy the happy hours in busy Saigon.

timeline.title: DAY 1. ARRIVAL – HANOI
timeline.description:
In and around Hanoi, Da NangUpon arrival at Noibai Airport, you’ll be met by our tour guide & transferred to your hotel in Hanoi for a Check-in. The rest of time, you’ll be free on your own. O/N in Hanoi.Start point
 Your hotel, Hanoi, Vietnam 08:00

timeline.title: DAY 2. HANOI ONE-DAY GROUP TOUR TO HALONG (B/L/-)
timeline.description: After having breakfast at hotel, you’ll be at leisure in the lobby. 7:50 – 8:30: Our cruise’s shuttle bus and tour guide pick up at your hotel in Hanoi old quarter, then take about 3.5 hour drive to Halong Bay. 12:15: Arrive in Bai Chay tourist wharf, welcomed by crew on our cruise and enjoy welcome drinks, take photos12:45: Sailing forward to looking stunning scenery with thousands of limestone mountains and  have seafood lunch while cruising through the emerald water passing by the Dog Stone, the Burning Incense Islet, stop at fishing village for kayaking – you will have 30 – 35 minutes to explore some grottoes and islets by yourself. After that visit Fighting-Cock rock and the Heavenly Palace (Thien Cung cave) – which has opened to the public since 1998 with stalagmites and stalactites. Back to Cruise. Our staff serves you cold tissues and fresh fruits. 16:15: Back to Tourist wharf and get on bus to Hanoi. 20:00: Arrive in Hanoi.  O/N in Hanoi.

timeline.title: DAY 3. HANOI – FREE DAY – NIGHT TRAIN TO DANANG (BSS)
timeline.description: Today you will have leisure time for shopping or discover Hanoi by yourself (No Guide – No Car) By the end of day at around 18:30, we’ll be transferred to the Hanoi Railway Station for a night train to Da Nang on SE1 (19:30 – 11:40 +). Overnight on train.

timeline.description: In and around Hoi An, Ho Chi Minh CityUpon getting to the Da Nang Railway Station, you’ll be welcome & escorted to your hotel in Hoi An for a check-in. The rest of time, you’ll be free on your own. O/N in Hoi An.

timeline.title: DAY 5. HOI AN AT LEISURE (B/-/-)

timeline.title: DAY 6. HOI AN – DA NANG – FLIGHT TO SAIGON (NOT INCLUDED) (B/-/-)

name: Hoi An Motorcycle Tour to Saigon on Ho Chi Minh Trail via Kham Duc, Kon Tum, Buon Ma Thuot, Dak Mil, Dong Xoai
summary: This 6-day Timeless Hoi An Motorcycle Tour to Saigon via Kon Tum, Buon Ma Thuot on Ho Chi Minh trail takes you on adventure rides to explore breathtaking landscapes of Central Highlands with coffee plantations, waterfalls, jungles and visit ethnic minorities in remote villages then taste great local foods at regions …

timeline.title: Day 1: Hoi An motorbike tour to Kham Duc
timeline.description: In and around Hoi An, Ho Chi Minh CitySaying goodbye with Hoi An ancient city, we will see how to make incense, visit Cham tower and Cao Dai Temple. Travelling on Ho Chi Minh trail, we will enjoy its magnificent scenery, exploring the rural life of the local people, learn their culture and customs We also learn more about the history of Vietnam and enjoy water massage on the Ho Chi Minh trail and the local market of the mountain town Arrive in Kham Duc around 5:00pm.

timeline.title: Day 2: Kham Duc motorbike tour to Kon Tum
timeline.description: Continuing Ho Chi Minh trail, today we will ride to Kon Tum. On the way, we will stop at Charlie Hill, Indochine three Corner, Dak To – Tan Canh battle field, Phoenix airport, Wooden church that is combined of European style and culture of the Central Highlands Vietnam and     Kon K’tu ethnic village with their tradition Rong House

timeline.title: Day 3: Kon Tum motorbike tour to Buon Me Thuot
timeline.description: Wake up in the early morning to enjoy the fresh air of the highland town and walk around to visit Kon Tum market. After breakfast, we will get on the motorbike for visiting Sea lake – the eyes of Pleiku, War monument, Local house to learn how to make rice paper and rice noodle, Black pepper farm We will try to experience the daily life of local people Arriving in Buon Me Thuot around 5pm.

timeline.title: Day 4: Buon Me Thuot motorbike tour to Dak Mil
timeline.description: This is one of the best days of the tour, so don’t miss anything! Before leaving Buon Me Thuot, let’s enjoy the best coffee in Vietnam (Buon Me Thuot is coffee homeland of Vietnam) and visit Ede ethnic minority village where still keep their tradition long house and local market where we will buy really special foods for our picnic lu’nch in the national park Following Ho Chi Minh trail, we will head to the national park where we will visit the Dray Sap and Dray Nur Waterfall – Biggest one in the Central Highland, and swim in Fairy pool, take a water massage from waterfall. Then Our guide will cook special foods for the lunch (Secret). Overnight in Dak Mil (Near Vietnam and Cambodia border).

timeline.title: Day 5: Dak Mil motorbike tour to Dong Xoai
timeline.description: We will Ride through the legendary Ho Chi Minh trail to enjoy its magnificent scenery, Explore the rural life of the local people and Learn more about the history of Vietnam. We continue to visit Soc Bom Bo village to understand S’tieng ethnic minority people culture and traditions and learn how the locals make rice papers, noodles,… Overnight in Dong Xoai (The beginning point of the Ho Chi Minh trail from South to North)

timeline.title: Day 6: Dong Xoai Motorbike Tour to Saigon
timeline.description: After breakfast, we will get on the motorbike to head to Cu Chi tunnel. On the way, we will stop at Rubber tree plantations, War Victory Monument, Paddy field We will spend few hours to discover the Cu Chi tunnel and learn Vietnam History, then will ride to Sai Gon to finish the trip. Our guide will drop you off at the place you require.

name: Hanoi - Sapa Highlight Package Tour in 7 Days
summary: LVP Travel will be willing to pick you up at Noi Bai Airport and transfer to hotel mentionded in Hanoi Old Quarter, relax in couple of hours before exploring some places surroundings. Customer must have to inform the Flight number and time of arrival, Driver and Guide will follow and pick up service offered. Single Traveller will be charged 180$ due to the luxury carbin room on Halong Bay Cruise

timeline.title: Day 1: Hanoi
timeline.description:
In and around HanoiBriefly Descriptions: Experience the contrasts of Northern Vietnam from the charming chaos of Hanoi to the relaxing waters of Halong Bay.  Highlight Vietnam Tour is a fabulous introduction of Vietnam's Culture and Traditional. Begin your journey in the capital city with a Hanoi Capital full day city tour.  Visit the Temple of Literature and the mausoleum of Ho Chi Minh for a touch of history before heading through the busy Old Quarter.  Relax at the end of the day with a coffee at a local lakeside café and marvel at the seemingly endless stream of motorbikes. Enjoy the beautiful scenery diversity hill tribes, very peaceful and green rice terraces in Sapa - the roof of Indochina.
Leave the hustles of the city behind as you travel east to the Gulf of Tonkin and board a traditional wooden junk boat.  An overnight cruise on Halong Bay is the remarkable opportunity to truly appreciate the beautiful limestone, karts mountains, spending the hours sailing among limestone cliffs and Emerald seas.  Stop to visit a mysterious cave, swimming in the warm waters and feast on fresh seafood.
we can tailor your family journey to the central or south of Vietnam with more history & Culture or also stunning sceneries in each destinations
Day 1: Arrival Hanoi Vietnam (Dinner)
Today you’ll land in Hanoi. Warmly welcome by Tour Guide & Car Driver at airport then transfer to Hanoi Capital City some called The City Downtown, a city of lakes, shaded boulevards, public parks, and the capital of Vietnam. Enjoy for leisure in Hanoi until 7:00pm. Take night train from Hanoi to Sapa. Overnight on the train. (Opt 4 Softbed- Sleeping Carbin or 6 bed sleeping Carbin)

timeline.title: Day 2: Sapa
timeline.description:
Day 2: Sapa arrival - Black Hmong Village - Red Dao Village (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)
Arrive Lao Cai Railway Station at 5 -6:00am. Pick up to Sapa town for check in. Having breakfast and start hiking down to Lao Chai village to visit the Black H'mong. Have a picnic lunch on the way then keep going along the valley to get to Ta Van village to visit the Dzay people live, which supposed to be the most friendly one in mountainous area. The next is Giang Ta Chai village of Red Dzao tribe where you will see the amazing scenery and beautiful waterfall. In the afternoon, you get back Sapa Town for free to discover Sapa Market & stay overnight in Sapa Town.

timeline.title: Day 3: Sapa
timeline.description:
Day 3: Lao Cai- Bac Ha Sunday Market - Night train back Hanoi (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)
After breakfast in Sapa, you leave Sapa Town for Bac Ha Town to join Sunday Market with local people. Bac Ha is considered one of the most fabulous and colourful markets in extreme north Vietnam where thousands of local people in their traditional attire buy and sell the local products. Dogs, cats, pigs, buffaloes,horses... all for sales or Barter. This is an unique opportunity to take your best photos! In the afternoon, we will take a pleasant walk to Ban Pho village, home to the flower H'mong people. This is a great opportunity to interact with the friendly locals and have pleasant walk amongst tribal villages. Leave Bac Ha Town at 3:00pm for Lao Cai Railway Station. Take night train, which departs about 7.30am. Overnight on the train.

timeline.title: Day 4: Halong Bay
timeline.description:
Day 4: Excursion to Halong Bay and Stay overnight on Board. (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)
Arrive Hanoi Railway Station at 5:30am. Pick up & transfer to hotel for short rest & breakfast until 8:30am. Leave Hanoi for Halong Bay, one of the most magnificent scenic environments in the world, Halong Bay. Covering 577 square miles, this vast bay is filled with more than 3,000 limestone “peaks” or karsts that jut from the deep blue water as far as the eye can see. We’ll spend a day and a half, including an overnight with dinner and breakfast onboard, exploring this overwhelming seascape from the decks of a traditional Vietnamese boat. Comfortable and intimate, your boat features hand-crafted wooden interiors including a dining room and pleasant air-conditioned cabins with private baths. Since we’re overnight on the water, we’ll be able to explore Ha Long Bay’s most beautiful spots with time to swim and even visit some of the largest rock formations and caves. This promises to be one of your most memorable travel experiences in Asia. Stay overnight on Boat.

timeline.title: Day 5: Halong Bay
timeline.description:
Day 5: Halong Bay Cruise - Hanoi. (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)
Rising to the sound of lapping bay waters, we have time for an early morning dip followed by breakfast. Sitting on the upper deck, you can relax while taking in the breath-taking beauty of the rocky islands rising from the emerald water of the bay.
After breakfast, explore Sung Sot cave, swim and relax. Cruises back to the jetty while brunch is served while you are cruising through the bay, along the way seeing more of the fascinating formations. Cruise check-out. Rejoin car drive back to Hanoi for overnight. Arrive Hanoi at 3:00pm. Check in hotel & free time to go sightseeing in the Old Quarter. Overnight in Hanoi.

timeline.title: Day 6: Hanoi
timeline.description:
Day 6: Hanoi Sightseeing full day (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)
Hanoi, a city of lakes, shaded boulevards and public parks, is the capital of Vietnam. It is a very attractive city with French-style architecture. You have a full day of sightseeing ahead, including a visit to One Pillar Pagoda, which was built by Ly Thai Tong and the Temple of Literature, founded by Emperor Ly Thanh Tong. Stop in the heart of Hanoi at Hoan Kiem Lake, which contains an islet with a tiny Tortoise Pagoda. After lunch at a local restaurant, visit Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, the Opera House and St. Joseph Cathedral. Conclude with a visit to Bao Tang Lich, once the museum of l'Ecole Francaise d'Extreme Orient, which includes artifacts from Vietnam's turbulent history. Water Puppet Show, Cyclo visiting Old Quarter. Overnight in Hanoi.

timeline.title: Day 7: Hanoi
timeline.description:
Day 7: Hanoi Conclude/ Departure. (Breakfast)
Have a Free Morning before Taking off to your hometown. comment on your facebook and remind when return Vietnam next trip.

name: Vietnam Specifically the North
summary:
It is your day to visit the Capital of Vietnam today. Let's start from the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, his simple house-on-stilts and the One-Pillar pagoda near Ba Dinh Square, where the most solemn ceremonies of Hanoi take place. Go on to the Temple of Literature, the very first high school of Vietnam Scholars

Afternoon, we will visit Hoan Kiem Lake and the nearby Ngoc Son temple, Ly Thai To statue. Walk through the Old Quarter, a fascinating network of narrow alleys and shop houses also known as ‘The 36 Streets’ – each street being named after the merchandise traditionally sold there, ranging from fabrics to crafts and from medicines to tombstones.
highlights: Stroll through Hanoi city with its best landmarks and historical-cultural sites
Visit Halong Bay renowned for its thousands of limestone and tranquil islets
Be amazed by the sublime natural beauty of Pu Luong's mountains and valleys

timeline.title: Day 1: Hanoi Arrival (-/-/-)
timeline.description:
In and around HanoiWarmly welcome to Hanoi, the 1000-year capital of Vietnam!  Upon arrival, you will be greeted by our local driver then transferred to Hanoi center to drop off luggage. Stay at leisure for refreshment after long flight. Please note! -Hotel check-in time is 14:00 -Depend on your arrival time, the program will be adjusted accordingly.Start point
 Arrival Hall, Noi Bai International Airport, Sóc Sơn, Huyện Sóc Sơn, Hanoi 140800, Vietnam 00:00 - 23:55

timeline.title: Day 2: Hanoi City Tour (B/-/-)
timeline.description: It is your day to visit the Capital of Vietnam today. Let's start from the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, his simple house-on-stilts and the One-Pillar pagoda near Ba Dinh Square, where the most solemn ceremonies of Hanoi take place. Go on to the Temple of Literature, the very first high school of Vietnam Scholars  Afternoon, we will visit Hoan Kiem Lake and the nearby Ngoc Son temple, Ly Thai To statue. Walk through the Old Quarter, a fascinating network of narrow alleys and shop houses also known as ‘The 36 Streets’ – each street being named after the merchandise traditionally sold there, ranging from fabrics to crafts and from medicines to tombstones.  Overnight in Hanoi

timeline.title: Day 3: Hanoi – Farm Tour and Cooking Class at Local Family (B/L/-)
timeline.description: Breakfast at hotel. Morning, we leave Hanoi center and drive to the west of city. Our visit will start from a local market since Le Dynasty, the most famous market in the region where many traditional items for sales, including: dogs, cats, pigs, chickens, ducks, and bamboo baskets. Be surprised about bustling and colorful market which is working under the canopy of old tree.   Next to the market place is nice vegetable farms, where we take a tour around vegetable fields growing a variety of produce including: cauliflower, cabbage, tomatoes, green peas, Chinese peas and corn, as well as fruit gardens with oranges, pomelos, papaya, etc. Join with a local farmer with his daily work. Depend on the season this will involve ranking, sowing, water greens, picking greens and other garden activities. During the work, learn more about cultivation techniques and lifestyle through the farmer’s stories. At noon time, we will visit a local family and learn how to prepare delicious local meals by fresh ingredients, then make traditional cake while learning more about Vietnamese family's customs. Enjoy special tea and local wine from the host. Bid farewell to the family and driver back Hanoi center later on. At leisure in the rest of the day.  Overnight in Hanoi.

timeline.title: Day 4: Hanoi – Pu Luong Retreat - Village Life and The Community (B/L/D)
timeline.description: Breakfast at hotel.  Early morning, check out and take drive to Pu Luong (150km from Hanoi). You enter Pu Luong Nature Reserve by road via a breathtaking mountain pass giving you a panoramic view of the whole valley. You arrive at your accommodation in time for a delicious lunch, followed by free time to explore the beautiful retreat, with its captivating panoramic views and tranquil setting.  PM: You have the chance to get close to village life and interact with locals living in the hills above the Retreat. Glimpse at daily life, walk around working farmland and rice fields, and get to know more about the local culture. Walking back the retreat for nice dinner. Overnight in Pu Luong.

timeline.title: Day 5: Pu Luong Retreat - Uoi – Lan – Hieu Villages (B/L/D)
timeline.description: AM: This is a common and easy walk around the most beautiful valley of rice terraces in front of the Retreat. We start to descend into the beautiful valley facing the Retreat where you walk around tumbling rice terraces. Then we will walk through small paths shrouded in vegetation to slowly reveal a picturesque Uoi village sitting at the base of a towering mountain. Your camera will not be able to sit still when you see the panorama view of the village from above. PM: Continue walk down hill to a local home, where you can take rest then take a cycle to go cycling around Lan village. If time permits, we will visit a local family where we can learn about their traditional brocade weaving (not guaranteed). Cycling through the rice paddies and village to village, bridge to bridge to explore more the scenic landscapes surround. You will end up at Hieu Village (the stunning village in the area), you will have a good chance to enjoy the Hieu waterfall, the sole one in the reserve. Ride back to the local home, where the car pick-up point. You will be transferred back to Puluong retreat for dinner. Overnight in Pu Luong.

timeline.title: Day 6: Pu Luong - Bang Scenic Village – Hanoi (B/L/-)
timeline.description: AM: After breakfast, take a short ride from the retreat to Dong Dieng village, Going down into the most beautiful valley in Puluong. Along the way you will have a chance to enjoy beautiful terrace rice fields and gorgeous mountains. Take a scenic trails winding to have a look of the landscape of rice field and the village, which were widen in your eyes. You will pass some homes on the way, you can come to visit any local family if you want, this is a great chance to learn more about life style and culture of the locals. It’s time to get back the retreat for lunch. After lunch, check-out the retreat and drive back to Hanoi. Overnight in Hanoi.

timeline.title: Day 7: Hanoi – Halong Bay (B/L/D)
timeline.description: If you wish to see how the Hanoi people rise and shine in the morning, wake up early and run to a lake close by your hotel, you can join an exciting scene of hundreds of locals, passionately attentive in their morning exercises of Tai Chi quan, jogging, martial arts, classical dance and so on. After breakfast at the hotel, we will head to Halong Bay, a Natural World Heritage as designated by UNESCO since 1994 and 2006, and check-in our overnight boat. Enjoy a trip on Halong with stops to visit caves or to swim and enjoy the sunset on the sea. Dinner with fresh seafood! Overnight onboard.

timeline.title: Day 8: Halong Bay – Hanoi (B/L/-)
timeline.description: Morning wake up with a taichi-quan or yoga exercises guided by the crew before having breakfast whilst your boat goes on between Halong islets. Return to the Wharf to be back to Hanoi by shuttle bus at midday. Arrive in the city around 3-4pm. Overnight in Hanoi. Optional:  HANOI STREET FOOD TOUR Navigating Hanoi's thriving street food scene can be tough. This unique, carefully designed adventure combines expert knowledge with flexibility to pursue your unique interests, bringing you closer than ever to discovering the culinary secrets hiding around every corner. Sample a wide variety of popular street food dishes, including bun cha (grilled pork patties with noodles), pho (beef noodle), crab noodle, pork porridge, and savory Vietnamese pancakes (ban xeo). Delve deeper into lesser known foods, including grilled quail, golden pillow cakes, beef noodle, eel noodle, shrimp cake, and snails. Enjoy an assortment of drinks and local dried snacks, and even visit a local market place.

timeline.title: Day 9: Hanoi at Leisure (B/-/-)
timeline.description: Breakfast at hotel.  Stay at leisure today at your own for relaxing or shopping around. Overnight in Hanoi.  Optional:  NINH BINH – HOA LU – TAM COC – BICH DONG CAVE Timing: from 8:00 – 18:00 Our guide and driver will pick you up from your hotel. Today will be your great chance to visit to Ninh Binh, one of the oldest capitals of Vietnam. The area is featured by lots of well-known sceneries, which include Tam Coc Caves and Hoa Lu ancient capital with the old temples dedicated to King Dinh & King Le reigned in 10th century. The visit in Ninh Binh starts by a visit to the shady Dinh and Le temples, the site that used to be the kings’ palace in 10th century. Further discovery in Ninh Binh will be continued by a boat trip in Tam Coc where spectacular limestone karsts jut out from the green paddy fields reminding about Guilin (China) and Halong Bay of Vietnam, which gives this scenery the name “Halong-bay-on-land”. Back to Hanoi late afternoon.

timeline.title: Day 10: Hanoi Departure (B/-/-)
timeline.description:
At your leisure until your driver comes to meet and transfer you to the airport to take the departure flight. End of services. Please note! Hotel check-out time is 12:00End point
 Main Entrance, Noi Bai International Terminal 2, Sân Bay Quốc Tế Nội Bài, Huyện Sóc Sơn, Hanoi 140800, Vietnam 00:00 - 23:55

name: Vietnam Beach Paradise - Halong Bay/ Mui Ne
summary: Mui Ne is listed in 20 idyllic beaches among Asia and results as the perfect place for adventurers who can enjoy activities such as kite-surfing, windsurfing or sand-boarding on its very famous sand dunes. Besides that, you can leisure on your own cruising in Halong Bay and explore the islands surrounding.These treasures of Vietnam is a perfect getaway for people who want to enjoy beach holiday in Asia.

timeline.title: WELCOME TO VIETNAM - HANOI ARRIVAL
timeline.description:
In and around HanoiYour trip begins with arrival to Vietnam. Your private driver will meet you at the airport and transfer you to the hotel. Check-in to the hotel and have some rest after the flight. Remaining part of the day is at your leisure. You can mooch through the streets of the city. Historic charm, architectural marvels, and products’ variety are splashed all over this area.  After enjoying the first day by yourself return to the hotel for a relaxing sleep. Start point
 Noi Bai International Airport Pick Up , Noi Bai International Airport, Sóc Sơn, Huyện Sóc Sơn, Hanoi 140800, Vietnam

timeline.title: EXPLORE THE LANDING DRAGON - HALONG BAY - SHARING CRUISE/L/D)
timeline.description: In the morning, check-out from hotel and get pick-up by the Cruise at 7:30 am. Take the most scenic route to Halong Bay across the Red River Delta with emerald green rice paddies. On arrival to Halong, you will take a cruise on the bay to explore the limestone rocks and the karst grottoes.  After you are done with your exploration of the bay, it is time to enjoy an utterly delicious seafood lunch, after which a trip to the famous limestone cave in Ha Long bay, you’ll get to spend some time here, kayaking or swimming, so that you can get closer to the floating villages and shops. Towards the evening, you will return to the boat for an early dinner, followed by some time at leisure. You can also attend the activities taking part on the boat. Overnight on cruise (Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner)

timeline.title: MORNING RISE IN VIETNAM'S MOST FAMOUS BAY (B/L)
timeline.description: Rise early for a Tai Chi lesson or just to enjoy a hearty breakfast. The boat will make its way back to the port stopping at the Cave of Surprises, full of stalagmites and stalactites or at the floating village. From here, you will sail back to the main harbor and return to Hanoi (around 16:30-17:00). Drop at hotel in Hanoi. Free at your leisure time. (Meals: breakfast, lunch)

timeline.title: ESCAPE FROM CITIES' HUSTLE WITH BA VI ECO TOUR (B/L)
timeline.description: 08:00 – Start your trip to Ri village in Ba Vi. After 1.5 hours’ driving, you will arrive your Mr Duoc’s house with a welcome drink. 10:00 – Then visiting the 30-year-old tea plantation in Ri Village. This is a green and peaceful place that to enjoy beautiful scenery of the village. This Tea Plantation plays important role in providing tea products for the whole north of Vietnam. You will have a chance to help local family to harvest tea leaves, you will know how to pick the best part of the tea tree to make the most wonderful beverage as Vietnam traditional tea. Mr Duoc is a veteran in Vietnam War and the owner of a large tea farm. He also is an expert in handling the raw tea leaves, he will introduce you how to make a good green tea before selling. You will have great time listening to the host’s stories of his life in Vietnam war and enjoying the tea with green lentils or lotus seeds that made by his family. 11:15 – Driving about 10 minutes to visit another host family in Moc Village to give you a cooking class by Mrs. Chin – a host family. She will show you how to cook Vietnamese food, and you will have great time to enjoy lunch with food you done. 12:30: Have lunch with the host’s family and short break after lunch. ( Meals: breakfast, lunch) - Back to your hotel and ready for pick up to the airport for flight to Ho Chi Minh City -

timeline.title: DISCOVER THE FASCINATING CU CHI TUNNEL AND TRANSFER TO MUI NE (B)
timeline.description: In and around Cu Chi TunnelsHave breakfast and check-out from the hotel. Depart for Cu Chi tunnel at 8:00 am, the trip will take approximately one and a half hours bus driving. Upon arrival, before exploring the tunnels, you will have some short introduction followed by video about how the tunnels were constructed and how the people survived in the harsh conditions of the war time. Then, spend your time exploring the remaining area and tunnel systems which includes the special constructed living areas with kitchens, bedrooms side by side with other martial facilities like storage, weapons factories, field hospitals, and command centers. Besides, there are also many hidden trap doors and dangerous traps within the maze-like tunnels for security purpose during the war. Afterward, special tea and cassava (guerilla’s food during the war) will be served.  Break time for relax or time for those who want to try the real shooting gun.  Return to Saigon at 14:00, to pick your luggage up at the hotel and short break. Transfer from Ho Chi Minh city to Mui Ne beach!  Overnight in Mui Ne (Meals: breakfast)

timeline.title: IT'S TIME FOR THE BEACH - MUI NE LEISURE (B)
timeline.description: Have a leisure day exploring Mui Ne beaches or just relax at your resort. (Meals: breakfast)

timeline.title: BEACH TIME IS NEVER ENOUGH - MUI NE LEISURE (B)
timeline.description: Have a leisure day exploring Mui Ne beaches or just relax at your resort. (Meals: breakfast)

timeline.title: LEISURE TIME IN MUI NE AND TRAVEL BACK TO HO CHI MINH CITY (B)
timeline.description: In and around Ho Chi Minh CityLeisure day on the beach – Then we will transfer you back to Ho Chi Minh City in the afternoon by private vehicle. Overnight in Ho Chi Minh City  (Meals: breakfast)

timeline.title: BIGGEST FAREWELL AND WARMEST THANK YOU - HO CHI MINH DEPARTURE (B)
timeline.description:
Relish a healthy breakfast on the final day of your trip. Complete the hotel check-out formalities after which you can visit the local markets and buy souvenirs for your loved ones. Later, proceed for departure and board your flight back home. (Meals: breakfast)End point
 Tan Son Nhat International Airport Drop Off, Tan Son Nhat International Airport, Trường Sơn, Hồ Chí Minh, 736400, Vietnam

name: Best Selling Vietnam Motorcycle Tour to Central Highlands and Southern Coast with Da Lat, Nha Trang, Phan Thiet, Vung Tau
summary: This Vietnam Motorcycle Tour to Da Lat, Nha Trang, Phan Thiet, Vung Tau is an ideal combination between the Highlands and the Coast with a start from Saigon via Bao Loc, Lam Dong, Da Lat where you can have chance to visit grand coffee plantations, hill tribe's villages then downward to Nha Trang & along the beach to Phan Thiet, Mui Ne and Vung Tau to experience very beautiful beaches.

timeline.title: Day 1: HO CHI MINH CITY MOTORBIKING TOURS TO BAO LOC – LAM DONG MOTORCYCLE TOURS TO DA LAT (-/L/D)
timeline.description:
In and around Ho Chi Minh CityThe journey northwards begins as we depart Ho Chi Minh and pass through The influence of the French is evident in local culture and architecture since Da Lat was founded as a hill retreat for the colonials to escape the oppressive heat in the coastal plains and the chaos of Saigon.  This charming town is set around a lake and surrounded by forests, waterfalls and rolling countryside. O/N in Da Lat. Activities: 250 km motors riding (6.5 hours) Offroad Biking over the mountains & jungles many tea and coffee plantations to the hill station of Da Lat, sometimes known as the “City of Eternal Spring”. The drive is long but views are fantastic all along the way. Once arriving in Da Lat we can soak up the cool climate as much as we want by spending our time to wander around and catch our first glimpse of this town.Start point
 Your Hotel, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam 08:00

timeline.title: Day 2: DA LAT OFFROAD MOTORBIKE TOURS TO LAK LAKE ~ 160 KM (8:30 – 16:30)
timeline.description: What to see: on the way you can take a quick visit at the crazy house, travel along the country road to see the entire agriculture farm such as vegetable farm, greenhouse flower farm, coffee plantation, a visit of silkworm factory, rice wine making and elephant waterfall. Arrive at Lak Lake with a visit to the “Jun” Minority Village (M’Nong). Crossing the Lak Lake by boat to Lieng minority village, with many opportunities of taking pictures of people farming and fishing; Check-in at the long-stilt-house for the overnight stay. Where to stay: Homestay in Long Stilt house.

timeline.title: Day 3: LAK LAKE OFFROAD MOTORCYCLE TOURS TO NHA TRANG ~ 210 KM (8:00 – 17:00)
timeline.description: In and around Nha TrangWhat to see: on the way heading to Nha Trang, you have half an hour trekking to top of the Elephant rock mountain, back on the road again, on the back of the motorbikes you will have opportunities to observe the panorama view of rice paddy field along the road, and then, a quick visit to the Ede Minority Village.  One more waterfall name: Dray Nao waterfall between Lak Lake and Nha Trang, Descend along the Phoenix Pass (affect by Agent Orange) and a visit the Hot spring, the brick-making factory, 20 km ride along the beach will lead you to the most charming beach in Vietnam: Nha Trang beach then check-in at hotel. Overnight at hotel in Nha Trang.

timeline.title: Day 4: NHA TRANG MOTORBIKING TRIPS TO MUI NE CAPE (B/L/D)
timeline.description: After having breakfast at hotel. 8h00: Our motorbike tour will start leaving to Mui Ne, on the way we will stop by Ca Na and some other beautiful beaches to take a break as well as photos or if needed, you can jump on the sea to soak up yourself. Upon arrival in Mui Ne, we’ll check-in at a hotel then ride to a local restaurant for lunch.  This afternoon, we will ride our bikes to visit Fishing villages, Hong Stream, Golden Sand Dunes and Flying Sand Dunes, right here you can engage some optional outdoor games to make funs by yourself such as skating on sand or flying a kite… The rest of the time, you could take a bath on Mui Ne beach and view the sunset. Overnight at hotel in Mui Ne.

timeline.title: Day 5: MUI NE CAPE MOTORBIKING TOURS TO PHAN THIET (B/L/D)
timeline.description: Morning, breakfast & check out. Back on our motorbike and ride 35kms forwards to famous Phan Thiet. On the way, pay a visit at the Fairy Stream, then pause to discover the fishing village of Mui Ne and further on is the enormous red sand dunes. Continue your trip and enjoy the motor ride with a stop to discover how fishermen doing the daily work: net fishing, selling fish, mending the fishing net.  The last stop is at Bau Sen – a vast sand dune which has inspired numerous photographers for many years. We arrive in Phan Thiet around 2.00 PM. The rest of the day is your own at leisure. This day is also a chance for you to try windsurfing on beautiful beaches at Phan Thiet (optional).  Overnight in Phan Thiet.Phan Thiet – Ninh Chu.  Activities: 40 km riding in Phan Thiet (Mui Ne Cape) Swimming at Phan Thiet Beach

timeline.title: Day 6: PHAN THIET MOTORBIKING TOURS TO VUNG TAU (B/L/D)
timeline.description: Breakfast at your hotel & check out. Back on our “steel horses” and we will keep riding along the coastal paved road, passing quiet pine forest of Loc An and we arrive Binh Chau hot spring, take a mud bath and relax on Hot Spring Lake. Having lunch at a local restaurant en-route.  In the afternoon, we’ll keep on riding to Phuoc Hai hamlet, we will be impressed by the beautiful scenery, especially the sections of road straddled by mountains and beaches then Minh Dam historical mountain and Long Phuoc Tunnels before reaching Vung Tau.  Upon arrival, you’ll check-in at hotel and relax by yourself. Overnight at hotel in Vung Tau.

timeline.title: Day 7: VUNG TAU MOTORBIKING TOURS BACK TO SAIGON (B/L/-)
timeline.description: Breakfast at your hotel & then you’ll be at leisure on the beach or hanging around Vung Tau city till the time to ride back to Saigon.  At around 16:30, you’ll get to your hotel.  End of the trip.

name: 5-Day Trekking In Ha Giang
summary: Do you wish to explore Ha Giang in a better off the beaten track way? If so, this tour is specially customized just for you! Twisting up and down the steep hills covered with splendid terraced rice fields, heading down the fertile green valley and winding past isolated minority villages are what you should expect to experience. Get ready to be satisfied if you are an adventure-hungry trekker!

timeline.title: Day 1: Hanoi / Ha Giang (L/D)
timeline.description: In and around HanoiAfter pick up at 8 AM at your hotel, transfer to Ha Giang on a 6-hour drive. Chance to witness the change from the hustle and bustle of Hanoi to the peace of rural areas. Stop on the way for a short walk along some local villages. After lunch at a local restaurant, the drive will continue along Lo river to Ha Giang city.  Take the rest of day wandering around Tay villages where there are vivid rice fields, traditional wooden stilt houses tiled with palm leaves or relaxing by and cooling off in a wild stream. Have a local dish for dinner and call it a day.

timeline.title: Day 2: Ha Giang / Quan Ba (B/L/D)
timeline.description: Explore the hidden parts of Ha Giang city with a full day of 17-18km trek. Start from a local Tay village, up the off-beaten trails, winding through wild forests and captivating terraced rice fields to the highest point of Tay Con Linh range, which is the living place of Yao people. Chance to mingle with ethnic students in a local school. Lunch at a local Yao family for a break.  After lunch, do an easier trek down to the valley. Finish the trek in a Tay village after almost 7-hour off the beaten path. Next, head to Quan Ba district in Dong Van Karst Plateau Global Geopark.

timeline.title: Day 3: Quan Ba / Dong Van (B/L/D)
timeline.description: Enjoy the morning wandering around the village of Yao people on foot to learn about living tradition and culture of local people, or just go sightseeing in the village. After 1-2 hour of walk, transfer to Dong Van. After lunch on the way in Yen Minh town, time for a short walk to some isolated Hmong villages. Finish the day with a visit to the old palace of Hmong king before reaching Dong Van. If time permits, take a 20-min walk to the top of the mountain where there is a vacant French Fortress to enjoy sunset.

timeline.title: Day 4: Dong Van / Yen Minh (B/L/D)
timeline.description: Day begins with a visit to Dong Van market. If Sunday, chance to see a unique fair of the Hmong people. After the market, hike up the mountain to the edge of Nho Que valley where you can view to majestic mountain by the border of China. The 7-km hike leads to an acient traditional village of Tay people who live in amazing clay houses. Head back to Dong Van town on the same day for lunch before a drive to Ma Pi Leng pass.  A 20-min drive transfers you to the trekking point of Ma Pi Leng pass. Here you will be blown away by the stunning beauty of this top-of-the-world destination. This 3-hour walk leads to the top of the pass, through some local Hmong villages and ends with a stroll along the edge of the mountain looking down Tu San valley. After a short break for nature admiration, continue another 2-hour drive to Yen Minh through Meo Vac.

timeline.title: Day 5: Yen Minh / Hanoi (B/L)
timeline.description: Wake up in the morning to regret passing time in this wonderland before returning Hanoi.

name: 8 Days Discover North Of Vietnam
summary: Hanoi, Halong bay, Sapa, Tam Coc are the most popular places in all North of Vietnam. With all inclusive tour, Vietnam Travel Top will bring you to all them and guarantee your satisfaction. Please note that this tour consists of a combination of day tours, so you may have different tour guides on different days and you will meet different people during the activities.
highlights: Swim in the emerald waters of the stunning Ha Long Bay
Explore the emerald waters by kayak or bamboo boat
Learn more about rice cultivation in the mountain areas

timeline.title: Day 1: Airport pick up - Check in hotel in Hanoi
timeline.description:
In and around HanoiPick up the airport and then transfer you to the hotel in Hanoi Old Quarter – the most exciting place for tourist. After that you are free to visit Hanoi City by yourself. Note: Check in time is 13:00 P.M. Our people will greet and brief all informationa round the trip.Start point
 Hanoi old quarter, Hanoi, Vietnam 07:00 - 08:00

timeline.title: Day 2: Hanoi – Halong bay – Overnight on Majestic Cruises (B, L, D)
timeline.description: 08h00 – 08h30: Pick-up at hotel and start the scenic, 3 and ½ hour drive to Halong Bay. 12h30 – 13h00: Embark on Majestic Cruises followed by a short cruise briefing. 13h30 – 14h30: Savor a delectable lunch as Majestic Cruises among the limestone islands. 15h00 – 16h00: Explore the amazing Sung Sot Cave – the most beautiful cave in Halong Bay. 16h00 – 17h00: Cruising to Titov island. Go swimming and relaxing at the beach of Titov or climb up to the top of the island for a panorama view of Halong Bay. 17h00 – 17h30: Return to the main boat and continue cruising to the quiet area while enjoy beautiful seascape on the way. 17h30 – 19h00: Enjoy Sunset Party on sundeck and admire the best moments of the day when the sun starts to set. 19h00: Dinner is served. Socialize with other guests, take part in board games, fish for squid, or just laze around. Overnight on board.

timeline.title: Day 3 Halong Bay - Hanoi - Check in hotel in Hanoi (Meal: B, L )
timeline.description: 06h30 – 07h15: Start your day with Tai Chi exercises or a photo hunt. 07h30 – 08h30: Have breakfast on board and enjoy the peaceful morning of Halong Bay. 09h00 – 10h00: Kayak among the hidden areas of the bay, around the Man’s Head Islet area. 10h15: Return to the boat. Freshen up and check out of your cabin. 10h15 – 11h00: Continue your cruise exploring the Bay, passing Ba Hang fishing village, Dog Islet, and more. 11h00 – 12h15: While heading back to the harbor, watch the fruit carving demonstration and participate in the Cooking Class before enjoying a traditional Vietnamese lunch. 12h15 – 12h30: Disembark Majestic Cruise. 12h30 – 13h00: Transfer back to Hanoi.

timeline.title: Day 4: Hanoi - Sapa by bus - Cat Cat village – Sapa Hotel (L, D)
timeline.description: 6.30 – 7.00: Pick up from your hotel/stay, get on big bus and depart for Sapa. 9.30: Follow the highway to Lao Cai city with the first comfort break 11.00: Second comfort break at Lao Cai city before approaching Sapa 13.00: Arrive Sapa Town with colorful traditional costums of H’mong, Dzao, Tay ethnic People. Welcome drink and itinerary briefing Enjoy the lunch with local Vietnamese dishes, check-in procedures 14.30: A short drive to the gate of Cat Cat village which is home of Black H’mong ethnic people and is located near the bottom of a deep valley at the foot of Fansipan Peak. Our local guide will show you the daily life activities of the locals, trek down to the valley bottom to the waterfall where the French built a Hydraulic Power Station; stop for photo with bridge and waterfall then you will walk uphill for bus to pick up to get back to Sapa in the afternoon. Trekking distance is about 2.5 kms and it lasts for 2 hours 17.00: Come back to Sapa Town. Have dinner and overnight in hotel with night activities.

timeline.title: Day 5: Sapa - Y Linh Ho - Lao Chai - Ta Van – Hanoi (B/L)
timeline.description: 7.00 – 7.45: Have breakfast at hotel and prepare light pack for trekking 8.00: A short drive to Y Linh Ho then trek through the rice terraces and along Muong Hoa Stream to the Black Hmong village of Lao Chai to see the spectacular landscape of Hoang Lien Son Mountain after that heading to Ta Van village - home of Dzay ethnic people. Trekking distance is about 9 kms and it lasts for 3.5 hours 11.30: Bus picks you up at Ta Van Bridge to Sapa. 12.00 – 15.00: Have a shower at hotel, check out and have lunch and time at leisure on your own. 15.00: Meet all group members at hotel to get ready for Hanoi. 15.15: Get on bus to go back to Hanoi with two comfort breaks. 21.15: Check in hotel in Hanoi

timeline.title: Day 6: Hanoi Free Day (B)
timeline.description: You are free today to relax after Sapa tour or you can visit some villages around Hanoi. please contact Vietnam Travel Top if you need any arrangement. Breakfast and hotel in Hanoi are included.

timeline.title: Day 7: Hoa Lu Tam Coc 1 day tour (B/ L)
timeline.description: 8.00 – 8.30 am:  Picking up from hotel/stay. 08:30 Starting drive to Ninh Binh Province 10:00 Arriving at Hoa Lu Ancient Capital 10:15 Visiting King Dinh and King Le’s temples. 11:30 Arriving in Tam Coc Wharf. 11:45 Having buffet lunch with Vietnamese Cuisine. 13:00 Getting on Sampan boats through caves and visiting countryside landscape 15:00 Back to Tam Coc Wharf to chill out. 15:15 Biking on country road around village 16:00 Getting on shuttle bus to go back to Hanoi 18:30 Saying goodbye to you at your hotel in Hanoi. Note: Sometimes, we will switch to visit Tam Coc first and then Hoa Lu.

timeline.title: Day 8: Hanoi Departure (B
timeline.description:
We will arrange car to airport for you, please advise your flight details. If you need any further arrangement: tour to Hoi an, Ho Chi Minh City…please advise.End point
 Hanoi old quarter, Hanoi, Vietnam 18:00 - 19:00

name: Off the beaten tracks in North Vietnam 8 days 7 nights
summary: This eight-day adventure veers off the beaten path and into the wild and unspoilt beauty of Northern Vietnam. During the trip, you will trek through mountains, valleys and villages to discover the landscapes and cultures of Sapa and the frontier region of Ha Giang before winding up in the sublime setting of Ba Be National Park.

timeline.title: Day 1: Hanoi - Sapa (B/L/D)
timeline.description:
In and around HanoiOur guide and driver will pick you up around 7:30am for your 5 hour drive to Sapa. Simply sit back, relax, and enjoy as the scenery transforms from bustling metropolis to rolling hills and endless rice paddies.  Around midday you will arrive in Sapa, at which time you’ll get to enjoy a local lunch. Then for your first trek we will head through the rice terraces from Lao Chai to Ta Van village, which is inhabited by a H’mong community. Here you’ll get the chance to meet local people and share stories and information about your respective cultures with each other before you head back to Sapa Town by car for an overnight stay in a hotel.Start point
 Hanoi old quarter, Hanoi, Vietnam 07:30 - 08:00

timeline.title: Day 2: Sapa Trekking (B/L/D)
timeline.description: After enjoying a delicious breakfast, we start our trek by heading to the Red Dzao village of Ma Tra, followed by the village of Ta Phin. On the way here there will be stunning scenery of rice paddies and small villages everywhere you look, and we’ll end the day by staying in a local homestay in Ta Phin, allowing you to really get up close and personal with the culture and traditions here.

timeline.title: Day 3: Sapa - Ha Giang (B/L/D)
timeline.description: Today we’ll leave Sapa in favour of Vietnam’s final frontier, Ha Giang. On the way we’ll make a stop at Hoang A Tuong (or the “Cat King’s House”) in Bac Ha Town and have lunch in Chang Village, both inhabited by Tay communities.  After lunch we continue our drive deeper into Ha Giang, enjoying the spectacular scenery along the way, before finally reaching the Tay village where we will spend the night around 6pm, just in time for a home-cooked dinner. You’ll overnight in this traditional Tay stilt house.

timeline.title: Day 4: Ha Giang - Dong Van (B/L/D)
timeline.description: Once we have purchased the mandatory permit at the Immigration Office, you will begin the journey to Dong Van following a spectacular series of passes which wind through the mountains and valleys. En route you enjoy exceptional views of the rolling landscape and interesting flora and fauna. After that, we will have Lunch in the small mountain town of Tam Son visiting the villages of the H’mong, Pho Bang, Pho Cao. You will have the chance to see the former palace of the H’mong King, Vuong Chinh Duc who was an ally of the French. You will arrive in Dong Van around 18:00 where you will have dinner at a local restaurant and spend the night in a hotel.

timeline.title: Day 5: Dong Van - Meo Vac - Cao Bang (B/L/D)
timeline.description: You’ll start the day off with breakfast and a visit to the Dong Van Market, where locals come from all the surrounding villages to purchase and trade for essentials they cannot produce themselves.   Then you will be making the trek up to Pu Lo fortress which was built in 1890 and evacuated in 1945. From here you can enjoy spectacular views of the entire region, before climbing 15 km to the top of Ma Pi Leng Pass, through a gigantic maze of limestone peaks, stone forests, and canyons before descending into the valley of Meo Vac. Winding our way through the valley, we’ll eventually reach Bao Lac village, where we’ll rest for a bit and have lunch before being driven to Cao Bang where you’ll spend the night in a hotel.

timeline.title: Day 6: Cao Bang - Ban Gioc Waterfall (B/L/D)
timeline.description: This day is likely to be your highlight of the tour, as we take you to one of the most incredible natural wonders in Northern Vietnam; Ban Gioc Waterfall. The drive here from Cao Bang is roughly two hours, and this breath-taking 300-metre wide cascade sits right on the border between China and Vietnam, amidst a beautiful mountainous landscape.  While you’re here you can spend your time relaxing in the glow of the natural beauty, take some amazing photos, and board a bamboo boat that will take you so close to the falls you’ll feel the spray on your face, practically sitting at the very edge of Vietnam, so close to China that you can actually touch it.  After enjoying the waterfall, you will venture deep underground into the magical Nguom Ngao Cave to discover the rock formations which have been carved by erosion over millennia.  After visiting the waterfall and cave, you will travel down a beautiful road which is unknown to many, which winds through the mountains before reaching the Nung village of Quang Uyen.   You will be welcomed by Mr. Hung Dao, an amazingly friendly blacksmith, before having dinner at his house and settling in for the night in this cosy traditional Nung house.

timeline.title: Day 7: Cao Bang - Ba Be Lake (B/L/D)
timeline.description: Today we leave Ha Giang behind and drive through Ma Phuc pass on our way to Ba Be National Park. Once in the park, you’ll have time to explore the many wonders located here, such as the lake itself, the caves of Puong Grotto, the rapids of Dau Dang Waterfall and finally the tiny Widow Island located on the lake.  We’ll be staying in a traditional Tay stilt house overnight, staying with a local host family.

timeline.title: Day 8: Ba Be Lake - Hanoi (B/L)
timeline.description:
After breakfast, we’ll take you on a stroll along the riverfront to visit some surrounding villages, followed by a hike up one of the higher points around the lake, providing you with some impressive views surrounded by limestone formations and mountain peaks.  Following this we enter Hua Ma Cave, famous for its thousands of stalactites and stalagmites, and also known for being the biggest dry cave in Northeastern Vietnam. After lunch in a local restaurant, it’s sadly time to head back to Hanoi and say our goodbyes, arriving at your hotel around 5pm. End point
 Hanoi old quarter, Hanoi, Vietnam 17:00 - 18:00
